sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
The true-lovers good-morrow. A brace of valentines I here present, who now together live in hearts content: these luckily did meet upon the way, in February on the fourteenth day. The tune is, As at noon Dulcina rested.
1 sheet ([1] p.) : ill. (woodcuts).
Printed for W[illiam]. Thackeray, at the Angel in Duck-Lane, J[ohn]. M[illet]. and A[lexander]. M[ilbourn]., [London] : [between 1689-1692]
Verse: "In the month of February ..." Date, place of publication and publishers' names from Wing. Reproduction of original in the Harvard University, Houghton Library.
=======
The true-lovers good-morrow. A brace of valentines I here present, who now together live in hearts content: these luckily did meet upon the way, in February on the fourteenth day. The tune is, As at noon Dulcina rested.
1 sheet ([1] p.) : ill. (woodcuts).
Printed for W[illiam]. Thackeray, at the Angel in Duck-Lane, J[ohn]. M[illet]. and A[lexander]. M[ilbourn]., [London] : [between 1689-1692]
Verse: "In the month of February ..." Date, place of publication and publishers' names from Wing. Reproduction of original in the Harvard University, Houghton Library.
W[illiam]. Thackeray
J[ohn]. M[illet].
